description:
About the job

About Us:

Soul AI is a pioneering company founded by IIT Bombay and IIM Ahmedabad alumni, with a strong founding team from IITs, NITs, and BITS. We specialize in delivering high-quality human-curated data, AI-first scaled operations services, and more. Based in SF and Hyderabad, we are a young, fast-moving team on a mission to build AI for Good, driving innovation and positive societal impact.




About the Role

As a Social Science Research Annotator, you will support the development of advanced AI systems by reviewing, annotating, and validating social science research content. This role focuses on evaluating the quality of reasoning, methodological soundness, and contextual accuracy of AI-generated outputs across social science disciplines. You will apply academic rigor and critical thinking to help train AI models that engage responsibly and accurately with complex social, cultural, and institutional topics.




Roles & Responsibilities

Annotate and label social science questions, analyses, summaries, and research-style content for AI training and evaluation.
Review and validate AI-generated outputs related to sociology, political science, anthropology, psychology, human geography, and related fields.
Assess theoretical frameworks, conceptual clarity, and use of social science terminology and constructs.
Evaluate research reasoning for methodological validity, including study design, sampling, measurement, and interpretation of findings.
Ensure annotations reflect ethical considerations, bias awareness, and responsible handling of sensitive social topics.




Skills & Experience Required

BA/MA in Psychology, Sociology, Social Sciences, or related fields
Research exposure through coursework or internships
Strong understanding of experimental design and qualitative reasoning
Ability to identify biases, sampling issues, and methodological inconsistencies
strong in evaluating study designs and reasoning quality.




Why Join Us?

Work on high-impact projects that contribute to building AI for Good.
Collaborate with top-tier engineers and domain experts from IITs, NITs, and BITS.
Opportunity to grow in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.




NOTE: This will be a flexible freelancing opportunity. Pay will vary by project and typically is up to â‚¹1500 per hour.

description:
About the job

About Us:

Soul AI is a pioneering company founded by IIT Bombay and IIM Ahmedabad alumni, with a strong founding team from IITs, NITs, and BITS. We specialize in delivering high-quality human-curated data, AI-first scaled operations services, and more. Based in SF and Hyderabad, we are a young, fast-moving team on a mission to build AI for Good, driving innovation and positive societal impact.




About the Role

We are seeking a Mathematics SME with a strong foundation in advanced mathematics, including Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability, and Real Analysis. This role requires validating complex mathematical solutions, reviewing symbolic steps, analyzing proofs, and generating high-quality reasoning explanations. You will work on STEM/reasoning datasets, evaluate correctness, detect conceptual or computational errors, and produce clear, gold-standard solution.




Key Responsibilities

Validate step-by-step solutions for advanced mathematics problems across calculus, algebra, probability, and analysis.
Evaluate proofs, symbolic derivations, and logical reasoning for correctness and clarity.
Detect conceptual mistakes, computation errors, notation inconsistencies, or flawed reasoning.
Produce high-quality annotations, corrected steps, and gold-standard explanations.
Review solution chains for completeness, rigor, and mathematical soundness.
Collaborate with dataset and evaluation teams to maintain accuracy and consistency across STEM reasoning tasks.




Skills & Experience Required

BSc/MSc in Mathematics, Engineering, or related fields; Olympiad or competitive math background preferred.
Strong knowledge of Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability Theory, Real Analysis, and general university-level math.
Skilled in advanced math problem-solving, symbolic reasoning, and proof evaluation.
Ability to detect gaps in reasoning, incorrect assumptions, or logically invalid steps.
Excellent clarity in mathematical communication, explanation writing, and structured reasoning.
strong university-level math foundations, familiarity with proofs, symbolic manipulation
ability to evaluate correctness and clarity of reasoning and explanations.




Why Join Us?

Work on high-impact projects that contribute to building AI for Good.
Collaborate with top-tier engineers and domain experts from IITs, NITs, and BITS.
Opportunity to grow in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.




NOTE: This will be a flexible freelancing opportunity. Pay will vary by project and typically is up to â‚¹1500 per hour.

description:
About the job

You will partner closely with our founders and engineering team to own the design function at VectorShift. This is a hybrid role for a versatile designer who loves variety: one day you might be solving a complex UX problem for our workflow builder, and the next you might be build chat experiences from our 100k+ users.




You arenâ€™t just "making things pretty"â€”you are translating abstract AI logic into an intuitive, powerful interface that feels magical to use.




What Youâ€™ll Do:

Product Experience (The Core)

Own the detailed UX/UI: Lead end-to-end design for VectorShiftâ€™s core features, including our no-code pipeline builder, node logic, and data integrations.
Simplify Complexity: Take complex technical concepts (variables, loops, LLM chains) and turn them into simple, drag-and-drop interfaces that non-engineers can understand.
Ship Real Software: Deliver high-fidelity Figma mocks and prototypes that are ready for engineering. Work side-by-side with devs to ensure the final build matches the design specs.
Building Delightful Experiences: build end user experiences that make the users come back over and over again




Who You Are

1+ Years Experience: You have a strong background in Product Design, ideally at a SaaS, DevTool, or Productivity startup.
Portfolio that shows "Logic": You can share a portfolio that goes beyond pretty pictures. We want to see Case Studies that explain how you solved a difficult problem, from wireframe to final pixel.
Figma Master: You are fast and efficient in Figma. You know how to use auto-layout and components to keep files organized.
Technical Aptitude: You don't need to code, but you understand how software is built. You can speak the language of engineers and understand constraints.
Scrappy & Fast: You are comfortable with the "mess" of a startup. You don't need a 30-page brief to get started; you ask questions and iterate quickly.




Why Join VectorShift

High Ownership: You are not a cog in a machine. You are the design voice of the company.
Category Creation: You are helping define the UI/UX for the emerging field of AI automation.
Direct Impact: Your work will be shipped to thousands of users immediately. No red tape.

description:
About the job

This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Principal Product Designer - REMOTE. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to shape the design direction of innovative products that enhance customer experiences. By elevating design practices and leveraging AI-powered solutions, your work will significantly impact product evolution and user satisfaction. As a senior individual contributor, you will influence cross-functional teams and help bridge the gap between product vision and execution. Your expertise will be vital in driving high-quality design outcomes and fostering an environment of creative collaboration. This role offers you the chance to bring your vast experience to lead complex design challenges in a dynamic setting.

Accountabilities


Translate product and company vision into opinionated, future-forward design direction across major product areas
Think beyond near-term delivery to explore long-term opportunities, using concepts and prototypes to shape product evolution
Define and champion design principles and systems that support enterprise-ready, AI-forward experiences
Lead complex, ambiguous design problems end-to-end, from framing and exploration through execution and refinement
Partner deeply with Product, Engineering, and GTM to influence roadmaps and strategic decisions
Use customer research, product data, and insight to inform decisions while applying strong independent judgment
Raise the bar for design quality through critique, mentorship, and design leadership without people management


Requirements


8+ years of product design experience, ideally with B2B SaaS, platforms, or complex products
Demonstrated experience designing AI-enabled products, automation, or intelligent workflows
Strong prototyping skills used for vision-setting and alignment
Proven ability to take abstract product vision and turn it into a cohesive design vision
Strong systems thinker with experience designing for scale, extensibility, and long-term impact
Exceptional craft paired with strategic thinking and comfort operating in ambiguity
Track record of influencing cross-functional partners and driving alignment
Experience mentoring designers and elevating team practices through example
Comfort collaborating closely with front-end engineers and understanding technical constraints
A strong point of view grounded in user outcomes and business impact


Benefits


100% remote - All employees learn and collaborate using remote work practices
Solid health, dental, and vision plans; access to 401k (with a match), and generous parental leave
One-time $1000 home office stipend and an additional $500 annual budget for extra work-related technology
Monthly co-working space fees reimbursement available
Equity granted to every employee, investing everyone in our success
Team alignment through various meetings, newsletters, and annual learning stipends
Flexible Time Off policy allowing employees to schedule time off when needed


Why Apply Through Jobgether?

We use an AI-powered matching process to ensure your application is reviewed quickly, objectively, and fairly against the role's core requirements. Our system identifies the top-fitting candidates, and this shortlist is then shared directly with the hiring company. The final decision and next steps (interviews, assessments) are managed by their internal team.

We appreciate your interest and wish you the best!

Data Privacy Notice: By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Jobgether will process your personal data to evaluate your candidacy and share relevant information with the hiring employer. This processing is based on legitimate interest and pre-contractual measures under applicable data protection laws (including GDPR). You may exercise your rights (access, rectification, erasure, objection) at any time.

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

description:
About the job

Hiring Partner: Canvas Labs (on behalf of a Stealth Startup)

Location: Remote

Experience: 4-6 Years

Compensation: â‚¹24 - 30 LPA




The Short Story

We are Canvas Labs, we are helping build the founding tech team for a stealth startup that is set to disrupt the Consumer AI space.

Before I continue just a little bit about the team, Exâ€“IIT Delhi, leading strategy and engineering at world-class firms. And now theyâ€™re coming togetherâ€”Avengers-styleâ€”to build the next big category defining product.

We canâ€™t tell you exactly what we are building yet (shhh), but we can tell you this: It is a mobile-first product designed to bring the power of Generative AI into the daily lives of consumers in a way that feels like magic, not just "tech."

We are looking for a Product Designer who is obsessed with Mobile UX, loves the chaos of 0-to-1 building, and wants to design interfaces for intelligence, not just data.




The Mission

Most AI products today feel like "tools." We want to build a "companion."

We are moving beyond simple chatbots. We are designing a consumer experience that anticipates needs and simplifies complex workflows. Your job is to make the sophisticated AI backend feel invisible, intuitive, and delightful on a mobile screen.




What Youâ€™ll Do (The 0 to 1 Journey)

Own the Mobile Experience: This is a hard requirement. You arenâ€™t shrinking a desktop site to mobile; you are designing natively for iOS/Android. You think in gestures, haptics, thumb zones, and bottom sheets.
Define AI Interaction Patterns: How does a user interact with an AI that "thinks"? You will design the affordances, loading states, and feedback loops that build trust between the human and the AI.
Prototype at Warp Speed: In the early days, speed is survival. You will turn abstract ideas into tangible wireframes and high-fidelity prototypes (Figma) to test hypotheses with the founders.
Collaborate with the Best: You will work directly with founders who have scaled products and strategies at the highest levels. You will need to defend your design decisions with logic and user empathy.




Who You Are

The Experience: You have 3-6 years of product design experience, with a heavy portfolio focus on Mobile Consumer Apps. (SaaS dashboards are great, but we need someone who understands consumer psychology).
The Tooling: You breathe Figma. You are organized with your design systems but flexible enough to break the rules when innovation requires it.
The "AI" Curiosity: You donâ€™t just design static screens; you are curious about how GenAI works and how to design for dynamic content.
The Mindset: You are comfortable with ambiguity. "Stealth mode" means requirements change, pivots happen, and you need to be resilient and adaptable.




Why You Should Join

The Pedigree: Work alongside alumni from IIT Delhi, from top notch consulting and tech firms. This is a masterclass in high-performance execution.
The Impact: You are not Employee #500. You are a founding designer. Your fingerprints will be on the DNA of this product forever.
The Compensation: We value top talent. Offering a competitive range of â‚¹24 - 30 LPA.




The Selection Process

We know talented designers are busy. Weâ€™ve designed a streamlined process that respects your time while allowing your skills to shine.

Application & The "Sprint": Fill out the form. Along with attaching your CV and Portfolio, the form includes a rapid-fire Product Critique: The Perplexity Deep-Dive: Spend some time with the Perplexity mobile app. Identify three specific UX improvements or feature additions that would significantly enhance its stickiness or usability as a daily companion.We aren't looking for visual nitpicks; we want to see how you think about interaction models and user psychology. Submit 3 concise bullet points only.
Portfolio Walkthrough and : Show what you have done and be ready for some grilling :) 
The Discussion: Deep dive interview with the founders.




Ready to build the future of Consumer AI?

description:
About the job

Job Title: UI / UX Designer

Company Name: Wikasta Business and Technical Solutions Pvt. Ltd.

Employment Type: Full-Time

Work Mode: Work From Home

Working Days: 5 Days per Week

Salary Range: â‚¹2,40,000 â€“ â‚¹4,80,000 per year




About the Opportunity

Job Nexus India is hiring a UI / UX Designer for one of its client organisations. This role is suited for professionals who have a strong eye for design, a user-first mindset, and experience designing intuitive, scalable product experiences, particularly in SaaS environments.




Role Overview

The UI / UX Designer will be responsible for translating complex product and business requirements into clear, intuitive, and engaging user experiences. The role involves owning the complete design lifecycle and collaborating closely with product, engineering, and leadership teams.




Key Responsibilities

Translate product and business requirements into intuitive user experiences
Own the end-to-end design process, from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity designs and interactive prototypes
Design, maintain, and scale design systems in Figma to ensure consistency across the product
Collaborate closely with product managers, founders, and engineers to define and refine product experiences
Conduct user research, usability testing, and design validation, and iterate based on insights
Design experiences optimized for SaaS workflows, dashboards, and complex user journeys
Work in an agile, feedback-driven environment and iterate on designs quickly
Ensure designs meet accessibility, usability, and modern UI standards
Stay updated with UI/UX trends, tools, and best practices




Eligibility & Requirements

Strong proficiency in Figma, including components, auto-layout, variants, design systems, and prototyping
Proven experience designing SaaS-based products (B2B or B2C)
Prior experience working with startups or early-stage companies
Strong understanding of UX principles, usability, information architecture, and interaction design
Ability to balance user needs, business goals, and technical constraints
Excellent visual design skills with strong attention to detail and consistency
Ability to work independently and take ownership of design decisions
A strong portfolio demonstrating product and SaaS design work




About Job Nexus India

Job Nexus India is a staffing and recruitment firm that supports organisations by managing their hiring requirements. We work with client companies to identify suitable candidates and facilitate a structured and transparent recruitment process.

description:
About the job

Company Description

Pendamaze Studio, based in Kochi, India, is a premier game art outsourcing and game development studio dedicated to transforming creative ideas into exceptional games. Specializing in 2D art and animation, 3D game art, and game development services, the studio is committed to delivering high-quality, detail-oriented projects. Renowned for innovation, Pendamaze stays at the forefront of technology, constantly exploring new ideas to push the boundaries in gaming. Their talented team ensures a seamless process to help clients achieve their desired goals in the gaming industry.




About The Role:

Weâ€™re looking for a Junior UX Designer with at least 1 year of experience. Working Experience on mobile games is Highly desirable but not Mandatory. Weâ€™re looking for someone who is passionate about mobile games, especially hyper-casual and hybrid-casual experiences. Youâ€™ll work closely with Game Design, Art, and other teams to design simple, intuitive, and engaging player flows that hook players within the first few seconds. This is a hands-on role where youâ€™ll learn how UX directly impacts retention, engagement, and monetization in fast-paced mobile games.




What You'll Do:




UX & Player Experience:

Design player flows, wireframes, and low-fidelity mockups for hyper-casual games.
Create intuitive onboarding, tutorials, and first-time user experiences (FTUE).
Help improve core gameplay loops, menus, and feedback systems.
Collaborate with Game Design to translate game mechanics into clean UX flows.
Work with art to ensure UX aligns with visual style and clarity.




Testing & Iteration:

Observe gameplay and identify UX friction points.
Propose UX improvements based on research and insights.
Support A/B testing ideas for menus, HUDs, and onboarding flows.




Tools & Documentation:

Create UX documentation, flowcharts, and interaction maps.
Use tools like Figma, Miro, or similar.
Maintain clean, reusable UX assets for rapid prototyping.




What Weâ€™re Looking For (Must-Have)

Completed a degree in UX Design, Interaction Design, Game Design, HCI, or a related field.
Strong interest in mobile games, especially hyper-casual titles.
Basic understanding of UX principles (usability, feedback, hierarchy, affordances).
Understanding with Figma or similar design tools.
Willingness to iterate fast and learn through feedback.




Nice-to-Have:

Experience working on hyper-casual games
Familiarity with hyper-casual UX principles 
Basic understanding of game design concepts (KPIs, retention, funnels)

description:
About the job

Job Title: ESG Researcher

Location: Hybrid

Reports To: Co-Founder

 

Company Description

 

NixOut empowers businesses in the food and retail sectors with sustainable packaging solutions derived from natural materials like plant leaves, banana fibre, bamboo, jute, and more. With a mission to reduce plastic waste and promote environmentally friendly growth, NixOut supports Startups, SMEs, and established brands in transitioning to zero-waste practices. Combining expertise in ethical sourcing and innovative design, NixOut provides custom-tailored packaging solutions that align with UK regulations and consumer sustainability demands. By offering a comprehensive range of products, from compostable containers to home-compostable bags, NixOut aims to create a greener future for both businesses and the planet




About the Role

We are looking for a motivated ESG Intern to help shape the core sustainability knowledge base for our product. You will research ESG frameworks, standards, and metrics, and help translate them into data models. This is a hands-on role perfect for someone passionate about sustainability and emerging tech.




Key Responsibilities

Research and summarise key ESG frameworks and emerging regulations worldwide (Especially Europe).
Analyse industry specific ESG metrics (including carbon emissions, supply-chain labour practices, diversity reporting).
Assist in mapping ESG data points product structures (That includes how to tokenise or verify carbon credits, traceability in supply chains).
Conduct competitor and market research on ESG reporting and sustainability projects.
Help create content such as reports, blog posts, whitepaper sections, or pitch deck slides on ESG topics.
Support data collection and basic analysis (which is reviewing company sustainability reports, extracting key metrics).
Collaborate with the founder on integrating ESG insights into product roadmap.




Required Qualifications

Currently pursuing Master's degree or completed a Bachelor's degree in Environmental Science, Sustainability Studies, Business Administration, Economics, Law, or related fields.
Strong interest in ESG/Sustainability (prior coursework, projects, or personal initiatives are a big plus).
Basic understanding of ESG concepts (you don't need to be an expert).




Essential Skills

Excellent research and analytical skills (able to read dense reports and extract key insights).
Strong written English (for reports and documentation).
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Docs, Excel, Sheets, & PowerPoint).
Attention to detail and ability to organise information clearly.




What We Offer

Opportunity to work directly with the Founder on core business decisions.
Exposure to UK-focused international sourcing and B2B.
Hands-on experience in building a sustainable sourcing ecosystem from the ground up.
Performance-based growth, long-term role expansion.

Weâ€™re looking for a talented and detail-driven UI/UX Designer to join our product team.

Candidate will be responsible for designing intuitive, user-centric experiences

across mobile and web platforms. You will translate user needs into functional, visually

appealing interfaces that support the product vision and help grow our application into

a leading platform in the region.




Key Responsibilities:




â€¢ Collaborate with product managers and engineers to gather and evaluate user

requirements.

range of devices and interfaces.

branding guidelines.

â€¢ Create and maintain style guides, UI kits, and reusable components.

â€¢ Identify and troubleshoot UX issues, focusing on responsiveness, accessibility,

and consistency.

â€¢ Conduct layout refinements based on internal reviews and real user feedback.
